headline: 'Why War?': How thinkers answer this heartbreaking question
description: Since the bloodbath of World War I, philosophers have repeatedly grappled with the question: Is war an irrepressible human urge, or the product of historical and social forces?

headline: Europe will 'stand united' in response to Trump's tariff threats over Greenland
Wildfires in Chile kill at least 15, force 50,000 to evacuate in the south
As Iranians face repression, 'inaction amounts to passive complicity'
description: What is taking place in Iran today is no longer a sporadic crackdown, but a massacre, warn nearly 200 figures from the cultural sphere.

headline: Syria's leader agrees truce deal with Kurds after government troops advance
description: The agreement, which includes a ceasefire, will see the Kurdish administration and forces integrate into the state. It comes after deadly clashes in the Syrian city of Raqa on Sunday between Kurdish-led forces and local fighters loyal to Damascus.

headline: New York rapper A$AP Rocky makes comeback in new album, balancing fury and serenity
description: After an eight-year wait, the artist – and Rihanna's partner – has released his fourth album, 'Don't Be Dumb.' The varied and accomplished record features collaborations with Tim Burton, Tyler, The Creator, Doechii and Damon Albarn.

headline: The meteoric rise of Arthur Mensch, France's AI champion
description: In less than three years, the co-founder and head of the young French start-up Mistral AI has become a leading figure in the rapid rise of artificial intelligence worldwide.

headline: 'Trump, hands off Greenland!': From Nuuk to Copenhagen, thousands rally against US annexation plan

Mercosur-EU: What the trade deal contains for the agriculture, minerals and industrial sectors
Is it ever a good idea to... wear white in winter?
description: In fashion, as in life, it is important to know the lines you should not cross. Or else, to do so deliberately.

headline: Venezuela two weeks after Maduro's abduction: 'I was scared, then I cried with joy. Now, I'm scared again'
description: Following the abduction of Nicolas Maduro, who has led Venezuela since 2013, Le Monde collected accounts from residents of Caracas and its suburbs.

headline: In Libya's desert, Sudanese refugees cross paths as they flee or return to their homeland
description: Between 350,000 and one million Sudanese refugees have arrived in Libya since the outbreak of war in April 2023. In the southern city of Kufra, refugees end up in unsanitary camps. With no prospects, some decide to return to Sudan, despite the horrors of the fighting.

headline: Terror, the Iranian regime's last resort
